Key Match Events: Sean Manaea lasted only 3 ²/₃ innings and surrendered six runs, one unearned, on seven hits and two walks with one strikeout.
Rhys Hoskins hit a grand slam in the first inning to give the Brewers a 4-0 lead.
Francisco Alvarez left the game with back spasms after sliding into third base in the seventh inning.
Mark Vientos hit a two-run homer in the third inning against Frankie Montas.
Gary Sanchez launched a solo homer against Alex Young in the eighth inning to give the Brewers an 8-4 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor commented, 'They outplayed us today. They scored, ran the bases better than we did and they hit with runners in scoring position.'
Sean Manaea said, 'It sucks. We’re fighting for our lives over here and to do that, it doesn’t feel good, but we are resilient.'
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said, 'I was very pleased with [our] at-bats and they kept fighting. We didn’t give up.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers went 6-for-6 in stolen base attempts.
Brice Turang drew a two-out walk against Danny Young in the sixth and swiped second for his 50th stolen base of the season.
